member.name: T:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext
member.summary: The base for a pipe context, with the underlying support for managing paylaods (out-of-band data that is carried along with the context).

member.name: M:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext.#ctor
member.summary: A new pipe context with an existing payload cache -- includes a new CancellationTokenSource. If cancellation is not supported, use the above constructor with CancellationToken.None to avoid creating a token source.

member.name: M:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext.#ctor(GreenPipes.Payloads.IPayloadCache)
member.summary: A new pipe context with an existing payload cache -- includes a new CancellationTokenSource. If cancellation is not supported, use the above constructor with CancellationToken.None to avoid creating a token source.

member.summary: Uses the specified payloadCache and cancellationToken for the context

member.name: M:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext.#ctor(GreenPipes.PipeContext)
member.summary: A new pipe context based off an existing pipe context, which delegates the payloadCache to the existing pipe context.

member.name: P:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext.CancellationToken
member.summary: Returns the CancellationToken for the context (implicit interface)

member.name: M:GreenPipes.BasePipeContext.HasPayloadType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if the payload type is included with or supported by the context type

member.summary: Attemts

member.summary: Get or add a payload to the context, using the provided payload factory.
member.param: The payload factory, which is only invoked if the payload is not present.

member.summary: Puts a circuit breaker in the pipe, which can automatically prevent the flow of messages to the consumer when the circuit breaker is opened.

member.summary: Configure a filter on the context pipe, versus the bound pipe

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Configurators.ICircuitBreakerConfigurator`1
member.summary: Configure the settings on the circuit breaker

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Configurators.ICircuitBreakerConfigurator`1.TrackingPeriod
member.summary: The period after which the attempt/failure counts are reset.

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Configurators.ICircuitBreakerConfigurator`1.TripThreshold
member.summary: The percentage of attempts that must fail before the circuit breaker trips into an open state.

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Configurators.ICircuitBreakerConfigurator`1.ActiveThreshold
member.summary: The number of attempts that must occur before the circuit breaker becomes active. Until the breaker activates, it will not open on failure

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Configurators.ICircuitBreakerConfigurator`1.ResetInterval
member.summary: Sets a specific reset interval for the circuit to attempt to close after being tripped. By default, this is an incrementing scale up to one minute.

member.summary: Configure a router for sending events from the circuit breaker

member.summary: The window duration to keep track of errors before they fall off the breaker state

member.summary: The time to wait after the breaker has opened before attempting to close it

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerSettings.TripThreshold
member.summary: A percentage of how many failures versus successful calls before the breaker is opened. Should be 0-100, but seriously like 5-10.

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerSettings.ActiveThreshold
member.summary: The active count of attempts before the circuit breaker can be tripped

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerSettings.Router
member.summary: The router used to publish events related to the circuit breaker behavior

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.ClosedBehavior
member.summary: Represents a closed, normally operating circuit breaker state

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.HalfOpenBehavior
member.summary: Executes until the success count is met. If a fault occurs before the success count is reached, the circuit reopens.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.ICircuitBreaker
member.summary: Provides access to a circuit breaker from a state object

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.ICircuitBreaker.TripThreshold
member.summary: The number of failures before opening the circuit breaker

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.ICircuitBreaker.ActiveThreshold
member.summary: The minimum number of attempts before the breaker can possibly trip

member.name: P:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.ICircuitBreaker.OpenDuration
member.summary: Window duration before attempt/success/failure counts are reset

member.summary: Open the circuit breaker, preventing any further access to the resource until the timer expires
member.param: The exception to return when the circuit breaker is accessed
A previously created enumerator for a timeout period

member.summary: Partially open the circuit breaker, allowing the eventual return to a closed state

member.summary: Close the circuit breaker, allowing normal execution

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.CircuitBreaker.OpenBehavior
member.summary: Represents a circuit that is unavailable, with a timer waiting to partially close the circuit.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.ConcurrencyLimitFilter`1
member.summary: Limits the concurrency of the next section of the pipeline based on the concurrency limit specified.

member.name: M:GreenPipes.Filters.ConcurrencyLimitFilter`1.WaitForRunningTasks(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: A hack, but waits for any tasks that have been sent through the filter to complete by waiting and taking all the concurrent slots
member.param: Of course we can cancel the operation

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.ContextFilter`1
member.summary: A content filter applies a delegate to the message context, and uses the result to either accept the message or discard it.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.DynamicFilter`1
member.summary: Dispatches an inbound pipe to one or more output pipes based on a dispatch type.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.ForkFilter`1
member.summary: Forks a single pipe into two pipes, which are executed concurrently

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.InterceptFilter`1
member.summary: Intercepts the pipe and executes an adjacent pipe prior to executing the next filter in the main pipe

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.IPipeContextConverter`2
member.summary: Converts the input context to the output context

member.name: M:GreenPipes.Filters.IPipeContextConverterFactory`1.GetConverter``1
member.summary: Given a known input context type, convert it to the correct output context type.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.KeyFilter`2
member.summary: Handles the registration of requests and connecting them to the consume pipe

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.OutputPipeFilter`2
member.summary: Converts an inbound context type to a pipe context type post-dispatch

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.RateLimitFilter`1
member.summary: Limits the number of calls through the filter to a specified count per time interval specified.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.RepeatFilter`1
member.summary: Uses a retry policy to handle exceptions, retrying the operation in according with the policy

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.RescueFilter`2
member.summary: Rescue catches an exception, and if the exception matches the exception filter, passes control to the rescue pipe.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.RetryFilter`1
member.summary: Uses a retry policy to handle exceptions, retrying the operation in according with the policy

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.TeeFilter`1
member.summary: Connects multiple output pipes to a single input pipe

member.name: T:GreenPipes.Filters.TeeFilter`2
member.summary: Connects multiple output pipes to a single input pipe

member.name: T:GreenPipes.IDynamicRouter`1
member.summary: A dynamic router is a pipe on which additional pipes can be connected and context is routed through the pipe based upon the output requirements of the connected pipes. It is built around the dynamic filter, which is the central point of the router.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.IDynamicRouter`2
member.summary: A dynamic router is a pipe on which additional pipes can be connected and context is routed through the pipe based upon the output requirements of the connected pipes. It is built around the dynamic filter, which is the central point of the router.

member.summary: Filter exceptions for policies that act based on an exception

member.name: M:GreenPipes.IExceptionFilter.Match(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true if the exception matches the filter and the policy should be applied to the exception.
member.returns: True if the exception matches the filter, otherwise false.

member.name: T:GreenPipes.IFilter`1
